 Hell no...I do not have a tattoo. I was in the Navy for years and never got one, but I saw many a fool who did. Those guys would come to me and say how much it hurts and "god, will this scab ever go away?" 
 If you do get a tattoo ask yourself, will I like this when I am 60?

 I like my tatoos I was years finding the right ones, I agree with you, you have to get something you like because you will be seeing it for a very long time. All 4 of mine have a very personal meaning.

I have one on my left upper arm. It has a very personal meaning, and will always be special to me. It is a part of me, just as the experience it symbolizes will always be a part of me. 
 
 As far as the rest, it didn't take too long to heal. I never got a "scab", nor should you if you continue to put antibiotic ointment on it as you are directed. Also, it did not hurt that bad, I would call it more of a minor burning. But then again, pain is subjective.

I have two tats: One is a cresent moon shape made of celtic knotwork. I designed it myself because I couldn't find one I liked. Woven into it is my son's name. As he is always part of me. 
 The other I don't like to talk about and actually would like to have it removed. I never wanted it in the first place...it's a really long story.

I wanted to refresh this thread as tattoos fascinate me. I do not have any myself, although I have ideas for a couple. I'm interested in not only hearing who has tattoos but what they are and what the story is behind them. Or even if you know the story behind tattoos of people you know. That's the great thing about tattoos, there's always story. All right then, who's gonna start?

FTR I was a tattooist for many years so...
 Left arm sleeved in Maori designs
 Right arm starting marquesan sleeve
 Lower back Greenman
 Right calf lotus flower in Maori design
 Left Calf marquesan turtle
 waist on both sides Borneo design
 to name a few
 emoticon_xangel

I wanted to refresh this thread as tattoos fascinate me. I do not have any myself, although I have ideas for a couple. I'm interested in not only hearing who has tattoos but what they are and what the story is behind them. Or even if you know the story behind tattoos of people you know. That's the great thing about tattoos, there's always story. All right then, who's gonna start?

 
 
 Start with my left arm it is a sword with rainbow notes floating off of it, on my right arm I have a sword with rainbow flames. Both swords are epic swords from a computer game I play called everquest. On my left chest I have a dove decending into flames a symbol for the pentacost. On my right chest is a Pernese blue dragon it is from the dragonrigers of Pern by Anne Mccaffery. I want to get a rainbow lizard crawling up my right leg that curves over my lower stomach area. PM me with your email and I will send you pictures.

I have a wolf's paw print on my left upper arm. Inside the bottom pad of the print in a wolf's head snapped back as if it were howling. The background is red with a yellow sun rising through the middle. 
 
 It represents something I saw when I was hiking in northern NM a few years ago. I awoke one morning to the sound of a wolf howling close by. I got out of my tent to turn and see the sun just cresting the top of a rocky outcropping about 50 feet behind my tent, appearing as a bright yellow ball with a red background. The wolf was standing just at the top of the rocky outcropping. It was the most beautiful thing I have seen yet in my life, and the closest I have ever felt to nature. 
 
 I have thought about getting something to represent kayaking, but that has already left enough scars on my body...so I think I'll skip that one.

No, I don't have any tattoos, but then I'm not eighteen yet so I can't anyway. I don't plan to either, because I just know the day would come when I'm 80 or so and there's a horrid, wrinkled tattoo that I don't want and that looks hideous. That said, I'm not slamming those who do have tattoos. Some designs can look elegant, but I'm not a fan of those tattoos that completely cover people's arms.
 If I did get a tattoo I'd get one on my shoulder or upper back, just the word 'Merlin' in some cool script. Merlin was my cat, well, he still is, and I love him. Actually, I might get 'Pidgin' as well... But my mother would disown me so...
 
 
I have a wolf's paw print on my left upper arm. Inside the bottom pad of the print in a wolf's head snapped back as if it were howling. The background is red with a yellow sun rising through the middle.
 
 It represents something I saw when I was hiking in northern NM a few years ago. I awoke one morning to the sound of a wolf howling close by. I got out of my tent to turn and see the sun just cresting the top of a rocky outcropping about 50 feet behind my tent, appearing as a bright yellow ball with a red background. The wolf was standing just at the top of the rocky outcropping. It was the most beautiful thing I have seen yet in my life, and the closest I have ever felt to nature.
 
 I have thought about getting something to represent kayaking, but that has already left enough scars on my body...so I think I'll skip that one.

 P.S I also love your signature. Has anyone ever answered it? emoticon_confused

 I've seen tattoos like that on public skin areas on team members at big city full service car wash businesses. Generally the job that allows hardened convicts employment to gain supervised parole at minimum wage. And regular citizens who consider tattoos a preferred adornment.
 
 The other resembles convenience store clerks I've purchased goods from, not to that extreme, but that style. There's decent comic strip titled Zits that includes a teen nicknamed Pierced for obvious reason. High school setting, normal mix of teens without violence or hatred. Contemporary Father Knows Best but Pierced and others in the strip would have been institutionalized in the 1950s based solely on appearance.
 
 Freaks? Nah, a changing society.

 Logically, I know that's not the case any more, but old habits die hard.
